description.plain:
Jason Derulo (born Jason Joel Desrouleaux), is an American singer-songwriter and dancer. Since the start of his career as a solo recording artist in 2009, Jason has sold over 30 million singles and has achieved four Top 5 singles, including “Wiggle,” “Talk Dirty,” “In My Head,” and “Whatcha Say.”

After producing records and writing songs for several artists, Derulo signed to minor recording label Beluga Heights. After Beluga Heights became part of the Warner Music Group, Derulo released his debut single “Whatcha Say” in May 2009. It sold over five million digital downloads, gaining an RIAA certification of triple platinum, and reaching number 1 in the U.S. and New Zealand. His debut album, Jason Derulo, was released on March 2, 2010.

He released his second studio album, Future History, on September 16, 2011. It was preceded by the release of the UK number-one single “Don’t Wanna Go Home.”

Derulo’s third international album, Tattoos, was released on September 24, 2013, while Derulo’s third U.S album Talk Dirty was released on April 15, 2014.

His fourth album Everything is 4 was released on June 2, 2015. Lead single “Want to Want Me” was released on March 9, 2015, and topped charts worldwide. It also reached #6 in the US.

description.plain:
Jason Derulo teams up with Nicki Minaj and Ty Dolla $ign for “Swalla,” a Caribbean-driven track that serves as the first single for Derulo’s highly anticipated fifth studio album, 2Sides.

On the song, Derulo, Minaj, and Ty go back to their island roots and deliver a sexy pop/dancehall track.

“You know we’re from the islands,” Derulo recently told Billboard. “We really took it there and it’s definitely a must-see.”

https://twitter.com/jasonderulo/status/834755941031616516

description.plain:
Jason Derulo teams with A-list sex rapper Snoop Dogg to make “Wiggle,” a joyous pop song about Derulo’s favorite thing: big fat butts. You could say it’s horny in more than one way.

The song has reached the top 10 in a number of countries including Australia, UK and USA.

In Feb. 2016, Derulo was on Jimmy Kimmel, providing a lyrical breakdown of what the song means, kinda like what he did on the site!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=15jJFlIHBEk

description.plain:
“Tip Toe” features French Montana, as well as uncredited vocals from Soaky Siren. The song was released on November 10, 2017, as the third single from Derulo’s upcoming album, 2 Side (previously title 777), after “If I’m Lucky” and “Swalla” featuring Ty Dolla Sign and Nicki Minaj.

The lyric video was uploaded on Derulo’s official YouTube account on the same day. Also, the single became popular in Europe, like peaking at #5 on UK Singles Chart.

description.plain:
Jason Derulo released “Trumpets” to International audiences as a single off his third studio album, Tattoos (2013), which he re-titled for release in the US under the name Talk Dirty (2014). “Trumpets” was eventually re-released in the US as the fifth single from Talk Dirty and peaked at number 14 on the US Billboard Hot 100.

Derulo made his directorial debut on the “Trumpets” video, and co-wrote and the song with Jon Bellion who also handled the production. “I met Jason briefly in the studio and played him some of my own solo stuff,” Bellion told Interview Magazine:

He kept my number and called me out of the blue and asked me if I had anything. “Trumpets” was one of those songs. I knew the drums were dope and it could work for someone else, but it was just a bit poppy for me. After my experience with “Monster,” I had to tell him that I wanted 90 percent of the publishing. He was cool with it, he liked it so much…

description.plain:
Released on March 9th, 2015, “Want to Want Me” is the first single from Derülo’s fourth studio album, Everything is 4.

The song peaked in the top forty in eight different countries, reaching #6 in the US — Derülo’s sixth consecutive top forty hit and sixth overall top ten.

description.plain:
“Whatcha Say” is an apology song about a man who cheated on his girl and now feels sorry after being caught.

“Whatcha Say” became a huge success in late 2009, reaching the top of the Billboard charts on November 14.

(Fun Fact: This song was was originally written for Sean Kingston.)

Production-wise, “Whatcha Say” heavily samples Imogen Heap’s “Hide and Seek”. Find out more about the production here.

description.plain:
“Colors” by Jason Derulo is Coca-Cola’s official anthem for the 2018 FIFA World Cup in Russia. Like the previous anthems, this song is a celebration which talks about all the different countries and flags that participate in the competition.

It’s a unifying anthem to the cultural diversity of our world, but it also claims all humans are equal, without races, just a big humankind plenty of colors and beauty.

The FIFA World Cup always links music and soccer like as Ricardo Fort, vice president of Global Sports Partnerships at The Coca-Cola Company, says:

“We believe that music and soccer are intrinsically linked by the passions they evoke. We are excited to welcome Jason to the team, and can’t wait to bring this upbeat anthem to the world ahead of the 2018 FIFA World Cup™.”

description.plain:
“Get Ugly” was released on April 7th, 2015, as the second promo from Jason Derulö’s fourth album, Everything is 4. It wasn’t released as the fourth single from the album until December 2015, though.

It was produced by Wallpaper., the same hit-maker behind previous hits like “Talk Dirty” and “Wiggle.”

description.plain:
The second single from Derulo’s second album Future History is an extreme turn from the lead single off of his eponymous debut album.

“Whatcha Say”, the lead single from Jason Derulo, is about a guy cheating on his girl and him pleading to get her back. Meanwhile, this track is pleading to get together with someone with no cheating implied, just an already existing cute relationship.

The song itself was pretty successful, reaching top forty positions worldwide. In the US, it reached #17. Ironically, that means it wasn’t even his biggest hit from the album: “Don’t Wanna Go Home” reached #14.

description.plain:
“Ridin' Solo” is Jason Derulo’s break up song. Rather than lose sleep over the breakdown of his relationship, he sees it as an opportunity to reclaim his freedom, to enjoy himself without answering to anyone.

The music video features Derulo at the piano singing the sad refrain “love made me blind,” before the futuristic production kicks in and the mood jumps up 10 notches. His positivity was a hit on the charts, as “Ridin' Solo” exploded in popularity worldwide. Top 10 in 5 countries, triple platinum in the US, triple platinum in Australia, and platinum in Canada.

description.plain:
“In My Head” is the third single off the singer’s 2010 album, Jason Derulo.

Billboard describes the song as featuring:

A rocking drumbeat, danceable hook, aggressive synth tap and intense breathy vocals from the artist.

The song peaked at the #12 place in the Billboard Chart and spent 20 weeks on it.

description.plain:
Jason Derulo dropped “If It Ain’t Love” a couple days before performing it at the iHeartRadio Music Award on April 3, 2016.

Jason Derulo went through a public breakup with his ex Jordin Sparks, back in 2014. The following year, he told Du Jour:

I think true love can never be broken. So I don’t think I’ve found true love yet.

A couple months before this track dropped, he announced his courtship with model Daphne Joy. Similarly, this song is about being in a new relationship and falling in love.

Musically, this song sounds like a poppy club hit, which makes sense given all of the producers and songwriters who worked on this track. The Monsters and the Strangerz have worked with Rita Ora, Maroon 5, Bebe Rexha and more. Ian Kirkpatrick produced tracks on Derulo’s last album as well as hits for Chris Brown, Justin Bieber, and Nick Jonas. Talay Riley is a British singer-songwriter and Lindy Robbins has been churning out hits for pop and country stars for over a decade.

description.plain:
“Cheyenne” is a single off of Jason Derulo’s Everything Is 4. Jason ends up falling in love with his latest conquest, to his dismay.

The instrumentals incorporate a funky guitar and an electronic bassline, in the vein of “Style”.

description.plain:
This song is on the album ‘Talk Dirty’ which is the reissue of American recording artist Jason Derulo’s, third studio album, ‘Tattoos. The collection was solely in the United States, after Tattoos was only released as a 5-track EP in the country. The full-length album, features songs from the EP as well as newly recorded songs and was released by Warner Bros. Records on April 14, 2014.

The track was produced by DJ Mustard featuring Kid Ink.

description.plain:
“Naked” was released on February 12th, 2016, after being teased on Instagram for weeks.

Derulo expresses his desire for a specific woman and also explores topics such as his mansion in Miami and his relationship with his former girlfriend, Jordin Sparks.

description.plain: The fourth single off of Jason Derulo’s second studio album titled “Future History”. Originally wanted to be a part of his third independent album “unsigned” in 2011 with a feature from Iyaz, In an album review for Derulo’s, Michael Cragg of BBC Music noted that the songs “revolve around the joys of being in a relationship or the pain of not being in one”.

description.plain:
“Swalla (After Dark Remix)” by Jason Derulo, featuring Nicki Minaj and Ty Dolla $ign, is a remix of the song “Swalla”, which was released on iTunes on May 11th, 2016. The difference between the “After Dark” remix and the original version is that this remix is a slowed down version of the song, and has a few new lines added into the song in both the first verse and the third verse.

Jason Derulo explained why he made the ‘After Dark’ version on James Corden’s The Late Late Show.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=flieChYguMU

description.plain: “Tattoos” is the title track from Jason Derulo’s third international album. It’s an ode to love that is lost and found again, and includes some very clever wordplay with love and tattoos.

description.plain:
The song features a vocal contribution from pop songwriter Julia Michaels. It was the first time Michaels was credited as a featured artist rather than a songwriter.

Michaels recalled to Billboard magazine that she got a phone call from Jason Derulo, who was interested in a song she had written, but wanted to make it a duet. She went to Derulo’s studio that night and recorded a demo, thinking he intended to give the part to another singer.

description.plain:
“Broke” is the third promotional single from Jason Derulo’s fourth album, Everything Is 4.

Taking a page out of his remix with Florida Georgia Line’s “This Is How We Roll” Jason mashes country and R&B to call out a golddigging girlfriend.

Keith Urban rocks the guitar, Stevie Wonder rocks the harmonica, and both give backup vocals.

description.plain:
“Talk With Your Body” was originally an unreleased demo by Jason Derulo, featuring guest vocals from Eva Simons, which leaked for the first time on February 3, 2019.

Featuring samples of Christina Aguilera’s 1999 hit single “Genie In A Bottle” in the chorus, Derulo serenades his girl about the erotic tension between them which he insists on being communicated during love-making.

The song was later officially released and included on Derulo’s EP 2Sides (Side 1), without guest vocals from Eva Simons for reasons unknown.

description.plain: This song is about a girl that Jason meant while on tour. He had a one night stand with her and then left. The problem he’s having with this is that he developed feelings for her. When he says “better be careful” he’s warning people against what he did.

description.plain: “Overnight” is an unreleased Jason Derulo song which leaked online on April 5, 2019. It is unknown if the song was intended for an album. The song is the same as Jake Miller’s song “Overnight” with some alternate lyrics, which suggests Derulo’s version is most likely a demo, with the song ultimately being recorded and released by MIller.

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1: Diamond Platnumz]
Aah! Waite rafiki
Ndugu shabiki
Wambie muda sa tayari ooh
Wa wewe na sisi
Imara thabiti
Pamoja tuweze fika mbali
Oooh oooh

[Pre-Chorus: Jason Derulo]
Saying, "Oh, can't you taste the feeling, feeling"
Saying, "Oh, we all together, singing"

[Chorus: Jason Derulo]
Look how far we've come
Now, now, now, now
There's beauty in the unity we've found
I'm ready, I'm ready
We still got a long way
But look how far we've come
Now, now, now, now
Hands up for your colors
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh

[Verse 2: Diamond Platnumz]
Kwa TV ama viwanjani, mmh!
Umoja ujenga kitu bora
(Celebrate, celebrate)
Shangwe furaha burudani, oh yeah!
Tukishushia Coca-Cola
Upendo kwetu ndio sera
(Wooooo)
Ah! Na mwema ujirani
(Wooooo)
Kuipeperusha bendera
(Wooooo)
Furaha isio kifani
Kwa maana

[Chorus: Jason Derulo]
Look how far we've come
Now, now, now, now
There's beauty in the unity we've found
I'm ready, I'm ready
We still got a long way
But look how far we've come
Now, now, now, now
Hands up for your colors
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
One hand, two hands for your colors
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
Whoa oh
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
Show your true colors

[Bridge: Jason Derulo, Diamond Platnumz]
Here we go, we oh we oh (here we go)
Let's put on a show, we oh we oh
(Let's put on a show right now)
Ooh! Penye umoja
Ndio penye mandeleo
We nami pamoja

[Chorus: Jason Derulo, Diamond Platnumz]
Look how far we've come
Now, now, now, now
There's beauty in the unity we've found
I'm ready, I'm ready
We still got a long way
But look how far we've come
Now, now, now, now
Hands up for your colors
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
There's beauty in the unity we've found
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
One hand, two hands for your colors
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
There's beauty in the unity we've found
Oh, oh, oh, oh, oh
Onja msisimko

[Outro]
Here we go, we oh we oh (here we go)
Let's put on a show, we oh we oh
Hands up for your colors
Represent your country
Raise your flag
Show your true colors
